item.title: Mari add a quote by Marie Curie
item.description: "Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less." -- Marie Curie

item.title: Mari add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mari add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Mari add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mari add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Mari add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Mari add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Mari add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Mari add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Fear not death for the sooner we die, the longer we shall be immortal." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Mari add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Hope is a waking dream." -- Aristotle

item.title: Mari add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Happiness depends upon ourselves." -- Aristotle

item.title: Mari add a quote by William Durant
item.description: "We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit." -- William Durant

item.title: Mari add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Give sorrow words; the grief that does not speak knits up the o-er wrought heart and bids it break." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mari add a quote by jennifer dimarco
item.description: "god lets bad things happen to good people to test their faith, but the goddess knows the faithful and knows that bad things only make people stronger. and there's nothing wrong with stronger." -- jennifer dimarco

item.title: Mari add a quote by Helen Hayes
item.description: "The hardest years in life are those between ten and seventy." -- Helen Hayes

item.title: Mari add a quote by Janette Barber
item.description: "I refuse to think of them as chin hairs. I think of them as stray eyebrows." -- Janette Barber

item.title: Mari add a quote by Bette Davis
item.description: "Old age ain't no place for sissies." -- Bette Davis

item.title: Mari add a quote by Catherine Aird
item.description: "If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning." -- Catherine Aird

item.title: Mari add a quote by Roseanne Barr
item.description: "I'm not going to vacuum 'til Sears makes one you can ride on." -- Roseanne Barr

item.title: Mari add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Mari add a quote by Margery Williams Bianco
item.description:
"Real isn't how you are made,' said the Skin Horse. 'It's a thing that happens to you. When a child loves you for a long, long time, not just to play with, but REALLY loves you, then you become Real.'
'Does it hurt?' asked the Rabbit.
'Sometimes,' said the Skin Horse, for he was always truthful. 'When you are Real you don't mind being hurt.'
'Does it happen all at once, like being wound up,' he asked, 'or bit by bit?'
'It doesn't happen all at once,' said the Skin Horse. 'You become. It takes a long time. That's why it doesn't happen often to people who break easily, or have sharp edges, or who have to be carefully kept. Generally, by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all, because once you are Real you can't be ugly, except to people who don't understand." -- Margery Williams Bianco
